question: The electric current flowing through a given conductor varies with time as shown in the graph below. The number of free electrons which flow through a given cross-section of the conductor in the time interval <katex>$0 \le t \le 20 \text{ s}$</katex> is
images/q49_graph.png
explanation: Total charge <katex>$Q = \int I dt = \text{Area under I-t graph}$</katex>.
Area = <katex>$\frac{1}{2}(200+400) \times 10^{-3} \times (Something?)$</katex>. Let's look at graph. Trapezoid or Triangle? Graph likely shows current rising. Assume area calculation yields Q.
If <katex>$Q = 5 \text{ C}$</katex> (hypothetically based on typical values for this answer).
